work.name: Bauer Human-Centered AI Institute, University of Houston
work.summary: Research on topics related to applied AI/ML in business processes, highlighting the data-driven analytical studies on digital platforms and supply chain management

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

Working Papers.name: Algorithmic Bidding in Procurement Auctions, with Meng Li and Xianghua, Wu
Working Papers.summary: Detect algorithmic overbidding in procurement auctions through experiments with Deep-trained AI bidders; Propose practical solutions to mitigate the inflation in prices based on an novel analytical model uncovering the mechanism of model-free value based learning algorithms.

Working Papers.name: Imitation Entry and Product Loyalty, with Meng Li
Working Papers.summary: Study imitative entry and its influence on technology innovation amid the product market competition, underscoring the positive externality product loyality have for the imitator and the overall market,

Working Papers.name: Trading off Qualities for Quantities in Matching for Bargaining
Working Papers.summary: Establish a two-tired model capturing how a decentralized platform optimize through implementing a centralized data-driven matching protocol, featuring on the information design in the digital multisided ecosystem.

references.name: Professor Meng Li
references.reference: FOUNDER AND DIRECTOR\Endowed C. T. Bauer Chair of AI

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
